member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Creates an empty mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.#ctor(char)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a mesh using the specified file.
member.param: Path to the mesh file.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Constant Mesh instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.assignFrom(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh})
member.summary: Copies the data including bones, surfaces, and animations from the specified source mesh.
member.param: Source mesh instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.swap(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: Swaps all internal data between this mesh and the specified one. Used to efficiently exchange geometry data without memory copying.
member.param: The mesh to swap data with.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoneName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets a name for the given bone.
member.param: Bone number.
Bone name to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoneName(int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the given bone.
member.param: Bone number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoneParent(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the parent bone for the given one.
member.param: Bone number, for which the parent bone should be set.
Bone to be set as a parent.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoneParent(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of the parent bone of the given one.
member.param: Bone number, for which the parent bone will be returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoneTransform(int,Unigine.Math.mat4)
member.summary: Sets the transformation matrix for the given bone.
member.param: Bone number.
Transformation matrix to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoneTransform(int) const
member.summary: Returns the transformation matrix for the given bone.
member.param: Bone number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoneTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Updates the array of the world-space transformation matrices for bones.
member.param: Array of transformation matrices to be set. Its size must be equal to the number of animation bones.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the array of bones' transformations is updated successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoneTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Populates the provided vector with transformation matrices for each bone of the mesh. The vector will be resized to match the number of bones. Each index corresponds to a bone in the mesh (0 is the root bone).
member.param: Target array for transformation matrices.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoundBox(Unigine.Math.BoundBox,int)
member.summary: Sets the bounding box for the given mesh surface.
member.param: Bounding box to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoundBox(Unigine.Math.BoundBox)
member.summary: Sets the bounding box for the current mesh.
member.param: Bounding box to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoundBox(int) const
member.summary: Returns the bounding box of the given mesh surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoundBox const
member.summary: Returns the bounding box of the current mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoundSphere(Unigine.Math.BoundSphere)
member.summary: Sets the bounding sphere for the current mesh.
member.param: Bounding sphere to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setBoundSphere(Unigine.Math.BoundSphere,int)
member.summary: Sets the bounding sphere for the given mesh surface.
member.param: Bounding sphere to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoundSphere const
member.summary: Returns the bounding sphere of the current mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getBoundSphere(int) const
member.summary: Returns the bounding sphere of the given mesh surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setCIndex(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the new coordinate index for the given vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface, use the getNumCIndices() method.

Coordinate index to be set in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface, use the getNumCVertex() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getCIndex(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the coordinate index for the given vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface, use the getNumCIndices() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setColor(int,Unigine.Math.vec4,int)
member.summary: Sets the color for the given triangle vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex color entries of the given surface.To get the total number of vertex color entries for the surface, call the getNumColors() method.
Vertex color to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getColor(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the color of the given triangle vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex color entries of the given surface.To get the total number of vertex color entries for the surface, call the getNumColors() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setIndex(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets both coordinate and triangle indices for the given vertex of the given surface equal to the specified index.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate indices of the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate indices for the surface, use the getNumCIndices() method.
Index to be set in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices.To get the total number of coordinate vertices, use the getNumVertex() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getIndex(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the coordinate index of the given vertex of the given surface if the coordinate index is equal to the triangle index.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate indices of the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate indices for the surface, use the getNumCIndices() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,int,int,int) const
member.summary: Performs the search for the intersection of the given surface target with the given traced line. Mesh local space coordinates are used for this method.
member.param: Start point coordinates.
End point coordinates.
Return array to write the intersection point coordinates into.
Return array to write the intersection point normal into.
Return array to write the intersection point indices into.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.
member.returns: 1 if the intersection is found; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNormal(int,Unigine.Math.vec3,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the normal for the given triangle vertex of the given surface target. The normal of the vertex won't be written to the *.mesh file. It will be stored only in memory.
member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex normal entries of the given surface target.To get the total number of vertex normal entries for the surface target, call the getNumNormals() method.
Normal to be set.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNormal(int,int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the normal for the given triangle vertex of the given surface target.
member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex normal entries of the given surface target.To get the total number of vertex normal entries for the surface target, call the getNumNormals() method.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumBones const
member.summary: Returns the total number of mesh bones.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumCIndices(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface.
member.param: Number of the coordinate indices to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumCIndices(int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of coordinate indices for the given surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumColors(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of vertex color entries for the given surface. Colors are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Number of vertex color entries to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumColors(int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of vertex color entries for the given surface. Colors are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumCVertex(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of coordinate vertices of the given surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumIndices(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the number of indices for the given surface: updates the number of coordinate and triangle indices. For example, if you pass 5 as the first argument, the number of the coordinate indices and the number of triangle indices will be set to 5.
member.param: Number of indices to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumIndices(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of coordinate indices of the given surface if the number of the coordinate indices is equal to the number of triangle indices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumNormals(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of vertex normal entries for the given surface target. Normals are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Number of vertex normal entries to be set.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumNormals(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of vertex normal entries for the given surface target. Normals are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumSurfaces const
member.summary: Returns the total number of mesh surfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumSurfaceTargets(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the number of targets for the given mesh surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Number of surface targets to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumSurfaceTargets(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of surface targets for the given surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumTangents(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of vertex tangent entries for the given surface target. Tangents are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Number of vertex tangent entries to be set.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumTangents(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of vertex tangent entries for the given surface target. Tangents are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumTexCoords0(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of the first UV map texture coordinate entries for the given mesh surface. First UV map texture coordinates are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Number of the first UV map texture coordinate entries to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumTexCoords0(int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of the first UV map texture coordinate entries for the given mesh surface. First UV map texture coordinates are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: Total number of the first UV map texture coordinate entries.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumTexCoords1(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of the second UV map texture coordinate entries for the given mesh surface. Second UV map texture coordinates are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Number of the second UV map texture coordinates to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumTexCoords1(int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of the second UV map texture coordinate entries for the given mesh surface. Second UV map texture coordinates are specified for triangle vertices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: Total number of the second UV map texture coordinate entries.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumTIndices(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of triangle indices for the given surface.
member.param: Number of triangle indices to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumTIndices(int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of triangle indices for the given surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumTVertex(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of triangle vertices for the given mesh surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumVertex(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the total number of vertices for the given surface target. The numbers of vertices and coordinate vertices are equal.
member.param: Number of the vertices to be set.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumVertex(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the total number of vertices for the given surface target. The numbers of vertices and coordinate vertices are equal.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setNumWeights(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the number of weights set for vertices of the given surface. Weights are specified for coordinate vertices.
member.param: Number of weights to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getNumWeights(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of weights set for vertices of the given surface. Weights are specified for coordinate vertices.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setSurfaceName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets the name for the given mesh surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Surface name to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceName(int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the given surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setSurfaceTargetName(int,int,char)
member.summary: Sets the name for the given surface target.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Surface target number.
Surface target name to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceTargetName(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the given surface target.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Surface target number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setSurfaceTransform(Unigine.Math.mat4,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the transformation matrix for the given surface target.
member.param: Transformation matrix to be set.
Mesh surface number. The default value is -1 (apply to all of the mesh surfaces).If all surfaces are chosen, the transformations of bones and animations will also be recalculated.
Surface target number. The default value is -1 (apply to all of the surface targets).
member.returns: 1 if the transformation matrix is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setSurfaceLightmapUVChannel(int,char)
member.summary: Sets a new UV channel to be used for lightmaps of the surface with the specified number.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
UV channel to be used for lightmaps of the surface with the specified number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceLightmapUVChannel(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current UV channel used for lightmaps of the surface with the specified number.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: UV channel currently used for lightmaps of the surface with the specified number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setSurfaceLightmapResolution(int,Mesh::LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION)
member.summary: Sets a new lightmap resolution for the surface with the specified number.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Lightmap resolution to be used for the surface with the specified number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceLightmapResolution(int) const
member.summary: Returns the current lightmap resolution for the surface with the specified number.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: Current lightmap resolution for the surface with the specified number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setTangent(int,Unigine.Math.quat,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the new tangent for the given triangle vertex of the given surface target.
member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex tangent entries of the given surface target.To get the total number of vertex tangent entries for the surface target, call the getNumTangents() method.
Tangent to be set.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTangent(int,int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the tangent for the given triangle vertex of the given surface target.

Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setTexCoord0(int,Unigine.Math.vec2,int)

member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of first UV map texture coordinate entries of the given surface.To get the total number of first UV map texture coordinate entries for the surface, call the getNumTexCoords0() method.
First UV map texture coordinates to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.summary: Returns first UV map texture coordinates for the given triangle vertex of the given surface.

member.summary: Sets second UV map texture coordinates for the given triangle vertex of the given surface.

Second UV map texture coordinates to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTexCoord1(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns second UV map texture coordinates for the given triangle vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Triangle vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of second UV map texture coordinate entries of the given surface.To get the total number of second UV map texture coordinate entries for the surface, call the getNumTexCoords1() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setTIndex(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the new triangle index for the given vertex of the given surface.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of triangle indices for the given surface.To get the total number of triangle indices, use the getNumTIndices() method.

Triangle index to be set in the range from 0 to the total number of triangle vertices for the given surface.To get the total number of triangle vertices for the given surface, use the getNumTVertex() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTIndex(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the triangle index for the given surface by using the index number.
member.param: Vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of triangle indices for the given surface.To get the total number of triangle indices for the given surface, use the getNumTIndices() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setVertex(int,Unigine.Math.vec3,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the coordinates of the given coordinate vertex of the given surface target.
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface, use the getNumCVertex() method.
Vertex coordinates to be set.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getVertex(int,int,int) const
member.summary: Returns coordinates of the given coordinate vertex of the given surface target.
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface.To get the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface, use the getNumCVertex() method.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setWeightBones(int,Unigine.Math.ivec4,int)
member.summary: Sets the vector of bone indices that affect the vertex with the given weight. Vertex weight is characterized by the following values: The 4 bone indices (see setWeightBones() / getWeightBones() methods); The 4 bone weights (see setWeightWeights() / getWeightWeights() methods); Number of weights (see setWeightCount() / getWeightCount() methods).
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex weight entries for the given surface.To get the total number of of vertex weight entries for the given surface, use the getNumWeights() method.
Vector of the bone indices to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getWeightBones(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns a vector of bone indices that affect the vertex with the given weight. Vertex weight is characterized by the following values: The 4 bone indices (see setWeightBones() / getWeightBones() methods); The 4 bone weights (see setWeightWeights() / getWeightWeights() methods); Number of weights (see setWeightCount() / getWeightCount() methods).
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex weight entries for the given surface.To get the total number of of vertex weight entries for the given surface, use the getNumWeights() method.
Mesh surface number.
member.returns: Vector of the bone indices associated with the given weight.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setWeightCount(int,int,int)
member.summary: Sets the number of weights that affect the vertex with the given weight. Vertex weight is characterized by the following values: The 4 bone indices (see setWeightBones() / getWeightBones() methods); The 4 bone weights (see setWeightWeights() / getWeightWeights() methods); Number of weights (see setWeightCount() / getWeightCount() methods).
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex weight entries for the given surface.To get the total number of of vertex weight entries for the given surface, use the getNumWeights() method.
Number of weights to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getWeightCount(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of weights that affect the vertex with the given weight. Vertex weight is characterized by the following values: The 4 bone indices (see setWeightBones() / getWeightBones() methods); The 4 bone weights (see setWeightWeights() / getWeightWeights() methods); Number of weights (see setWeightCount() / getWeightCount() methods).
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex weight entries for the given surface.To get the total number of of vertex weight entries for the given surface, use the getNumWeights() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setWeightWeights(int,Unigine.Math.vec4,int)
member.summary: Sets the vector of bone weights that affect the vertex with the given weight. Vertex weight is characterized by the following values: The 4 bone indices (see setWeightBones() / getWeightBones() methods); The 4 bone weights (see setWeightWeights() / getWeightWeights() methods); Number of weights (see setWeightCount() / getWeightCount() methods).
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex weight entries for the given surface.To get the total number of of vertex weight entries for the given surface, use the getNumWeights() method.
Vector of bone weights to be set.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getWeightWeights(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns a vector of bone weights that affect the vertex with the given weight. Vertex weight is characterized by the following values: The 4 bone indices (see setWeightBones() / getWeightBones() methods); The 4 bone weights (see setWeightWeights() / getWeightWeights() methods); Number of weights (see setWeightCount() / getWeightCount() methods).
member.param: Coordinate vertex number in the range from 0 to the total number of vertex weight entries for the given surface.To get the total number of of vertex weight entries for the given surface, use the getNumWeights() method.
Mesh surface number.
member.returns: Bone weights associated with the given weight.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addBone(char,int)
member.summary: Appends a new mesh bone.
member.param: Bone name. This argument is empty by default.
Parent bone number. The default value is -1 (the new bone has no parent bone).

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addBoxSurface(char,Unigine.Math.vec3,int)
member.summary: Appends a box surface to the current mesh. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Box size along the X, Y and Z axes.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addCapsuleSurface(char,float,float,int,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a capsule surface to the current mesh. The stacks and slices specify the surface's subdivision. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Capsule radius.
Capsule height.
Number of stacks that divide the capsule radially.
Number of slices that divide the capsule horizontally.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addCIndex(int,int)
member.summary: Appends a new Coordinate index the array of coordinate indices for the given surface.
member.param: Coordinate index to be added in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices.To get the total number of coordinate vertices for the given surface, use the getNumCVertex() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addColor(Unigine.Math.vec4,int)
member.summary: Appends the given color to the vertex color array of the given surface.
member.param: Color to be added.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addCylinderSurface(char,float,float,int,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a cylinder surface to the current mesh. The stacks and slices specify the surface's subdivision. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Cylinder radius.
Cylinder height.
Number of stacks that divide the cylinder radially.
Number of slices that divide the cylinder horizontally.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addDodecahedronSurface(char,float,int)
member.summary: Appends a dodecahedron surface to the current mesh. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Dodecahedron radius.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addEmptySurface(char,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a new empty surface to the current mesh. This function allocates only vertex and index arrays. Texture coordinates, tangent basis, weights and color arrays must be allocated manually.
member.param: Surface name.
Number of surface vertices.
Number of surface indices.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addIcosahedronSurface(char,float,int)
member.summary: Appends a icosahedron surface to the current mesh. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Icosahedron radius.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addIndex(int,int)
member.summary: Appends a given index to the arrays of coordinate and triangle indices for the given surface.
member.param: Index to be added in the range from 0 to the total number of coordinate vertices for the surface.To get the total number of coordinate vertices for the surface, use the getNumCVertex() method.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addMeshSurface(char,Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a surface of the source mesh to the current mesh as a new surface. The following example shows how to add a surface from the one mesh to another. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Name of the new surface added to the current mesh.
Source mesh to copy a surface from.
Number of the source mesh surface to copy.
Number of the target of the source mesh surface. The default value is -1 (all of the surface targets).
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.
member.returns: Number of the last added surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addMeshSurface(int,Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a surface of the source mesh to the existing surface of the current mesh. The following example shows how to add a surface from one mesh to another. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Number of the existing surface of the current mesh, to which the geometry is added.
Source mesh to copy a surface from.
Number of the source mesh surface to copy.
Number of the target of the source mesh surface. The default value is -1 (all of the surface targets).
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.
member.returns: Number of the last added surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addNormal(Unigine.Math.vec3,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a given normal to the array of normals of the given surface target.
member.param: Normal to be added.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addPlaneSurface(char,float,float,float,int)
member.summary: Appends a plane surface to the current mesh. The plane is divided into equal squares whose size is defined by the given step. The mesh will appear. You could see that the plane divided each 1 unit to equal squares.
member.param: Surface name.
Plane width.
Plane height.
Step of surface subdivision (vertical and horizontal).
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addPrismSurface(char,float,float,float,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a prism surface to the current mesh. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Radius of the circle circumscribed about the top prism base.
Radius of the circle circumscribed about the bottom prism base.
Height of the prism.
Number of the prism faces.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addSphereSurface(char,float,int,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a sphere surface to the current mesh. The stacks and slices specify the surface's subdivision. The mesh will appear.
member.param: Surface name.
Sphere radius.
Number of stacks that divide the sphere radially.
Number of slices that divide the sphere horizontally.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate for the new surface.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addSurface(char)
member.summary: Append a new surface with the given name to the current mesh. In the following example, we create a new surface and add vertices and indices to create a plane.
member.param: Surface name. This argument is empty by default.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addSurfaceTarget(int,char)
member.summary: Appends a target with the given name to the given surface.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
Name of the surface target. This argument is empty by default.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addTangent(Unigine.Math.quat,int,int)
member.summary: Appends the given tangent to the array of tangents of the specified surface target.
member.param: Tangent to be added.
Surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addTexCoord0(Unigine.Math.vec2,int)
member.summary: Appends texture coordinates to the array of the first UV map coordinates of the given mesh surface.
member.param: Coordinates of the first UV map to be added.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addTexCoord1(Unigine.Math.vec2,int)
member.summary: Appends texture coordinates to the array of the second UV map coordinates of the given mesh surface.
member.param: Coordinates of the second UV map to be added.
Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addTIndex(int,int)
member.summary: Appends an index of a triangle vertex to the array of triangle indices for the given surface.
member.param: Index number of the vertex in the triangle buffer in the range from 0 to the total number of triangle vertices.To get the total number of triangle vertices for the given surface, use the getNumTVertex() method.
Number of the surface to which the triangle index is added.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.addVertex(Unigine.Math.vec3,int,int)
member.summary: Appends a new coordinate vertex with the given coordinates to the mesh surface. In the following example, we create a new surface and add 4 vertices to it. We use local coordinates to define a vertex and specify the surface. After that we specify 6 indices to create a plane by using defined vertices.
member.param: Coordinates of the vertex to be added.
Mesh surface number.
Surface target number. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.clear
member.summary: Clears the mesh (including its bones, animation, surfaces and bounds).

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createBounds(int)
member.summary: Creates bounds (a bounding box and a bounding sphere) for the given surface. If the default value is used as an argument, the bounds will be created for all of the mesh surfaces.
member.param: Mesh surface number. The default value is -1 (all of the mesh surfaces).

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createIndices(int)
member.summary: Creates indices for the given surface. If the default value is used as an argument, the indices will be created for all of the mesh surfaces.
member.param: Mesh surface number. The default value is -1 (all of the mesh surfaces).
member.returns: 1 if indices are created successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createNormals(int,int)
member.summary: Creates normals for the given surface target.
member.param: Mesh surface number. The default value is -1 (all of the mesh surfaces).
Surface target number. The default value is -1 (all of the surface targets).
member.returns: 1 if the normals are created successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createNormals(float,int,int)
member.summary: Creates normals for the given surface target.
member.param: Angle between normals used to calculate the mean vertex normal.
Mesh surface number. -1 means all of the mesh surfaces.
Surface target number. -1 means all of the surface targets.
member.returns: 1 if the normals are created successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createTangents(int,int)
member.summary: Creates tangents for the given surface target.
member.param: Mesh surface number. -1 means all of the mesh surfaces.
Surface target number. -1 means all of the surface targets.
member.returns: 1 if the tangents are created successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createTangents(float,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Creates tangents for all of the surfaces in the list.
member.param: Angle between normals used to calculate the mean vertex normal.
List of surface numbers, for which tangents are to be created.
member.returns: 1 if the tangents are created successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.findBone(char) const
member.summary: Searches for a bone with a given name and returns its number.
member.param: Name of the bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.findSurface(char) const
member.summary: Searches for the surface number by its name.
member.param: Mesh surface name.
member.returns: Mesh surface number, if it is found; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.findSurfaceTarget(int,char) const
member.summary: Searches for the surface target number by the morph target name.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.flipTangent(int)
member.summary: Flips the sign of the binormal component of the surface tangent space.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: 1 if the sign of the binormal component is flipped successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.flipYZ(int)
member.summary: Flips the Y and Z axes for the given surface: Y axis becomes equal to -Z Z axis becomes equal to Y
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: 1 if the axes are flipped successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.info(char) const
member.summary: Returns the information about the given mesh or animation.
member.param: Mesh or animation name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.load(char)
member.summary: Loads the mesh with the given name for the current mesh.
member.param: Mesh name.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.optimizeIndices(int,int)
member.summary: Optimizes indices of the given mesh surface. As polygons are added to a surface, vertices of the adjacent polygons are duplicated (you can get the number of such the vertices by using the getNumTVertex()), because normals, texture coordinates and tangents of such the vertices differ depending on the polygons, to which this vertices belongs. The optimizeIndices() function serves to decrease the number of such vertices and create indices for them that will be stored in the corresponding normals, tangents and texture coordinates.
member.param: One of the flags used for indices' optimization: MESH_BACK_TO_FRONT or MESH_VERTEX_CACHE.
Mesh surface number.
member.returns: 1 if the indices are optimized successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.remapCVertex(int)
member.summary: Sets the size of the array of coordinate indices to be equal to the size of the array of triangle indices and increases the size of the vertex buffer to the size of the array of triangle vertices by using the coordinate vertex duplicating.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.removeIndices(int)
member.summary: Clears the coordinate and triangle indices of the given surface.
member.param: The mesh surface number. -1 means all of the mesh surfaces.
member.returns: 1 if the indices were cleared successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.save(char) const
member.summary: Saves the given mesh in either MESH or ANIM file format. Creates the given mesh path if it doesnt exist yet (including subdirectories).
member.param: Path to the mesh including the file name and extension *.mesh or *.anim.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is saved successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.sortSurfaces

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getMemoryUsage const
member.summary: Returns the amount of memory used by the mesh in bytes.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.hasSpatialTree(int) const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the specified mesh surface has a spatial tree.
member.param: Mesh surface number.
member.returns: true if the mesh has a spatial tree, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createSpatialTree(int)
member.summary: Generates a spatial tree for the mesh (or its specified surface), if it doesn't have any.
member.param: Mesh surface number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.setSpatialTreeTriangles(int)
member.summary: Sets the number of triangles stored in each leaf node of the mesh's spatial tree. Lower values (default is 4) improve the precision of intersection and collision detections, but increase spatial tree generation time and memory usage. Higher values reduce generation cost and memory consumption at the expense of intersection and collision detections accuracy. Useful for high-poly meshes or frequently updated procedural geometry.
member.param: Number of triangles per spatial tree leaf node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSpatialTreeTriangles const
member.summary: Returns the number of triangles currently configured per spatial tree leaf node.
member.returns: Triangle count per leaf node (default is 4).

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.hasEdges(int) const
member.summary: Checks whether edge data has been generated for the specified surface. If -1 is passed, checks all surfaces.
member.param: Index of the surface to check. If -1 is passed, all surfaces will be updated.
member.returns: Returns true if edge data exists, or if the surface has no geometry (empty edges are assumed).Returns false if the surface has geometry, but no edge data has been generated.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createEdges(int)
member.summary: Generates edge data for the specified surface. If -1 is passed, edge data will be generated for all surfaces.
member.param: Index of the surface to check. Index of the surface. If -1 is passed, the operation will be performed for all surfaces.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.clearCollisionData(int,int)
member.summary: Clears the specified types of collision data for the given surface. The behavior is controlled by the flags parameter, which determines which data types to clear. If -1 is passed for the surface parameter, the operation will be performed for all surfaces.
member.param: Index of the surface. If -1 is passed, collision data will be cleared for all surfaces.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to clear.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.createCollisionData(int,int)
member.summary: Generates specified types of collision data for the given surface. The behavior is controlled by the flags parameter, which determines which data types are created. This method must be called after any modification of mesh geometry. Otherwise, intersections and collisions may produce incorrect results due to outdated internal mesh structures.
member.param: Index of the surface to process. If -1 is passed, all surfaces will be updated.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to generate.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.hasCollisionData(int,int) const
member.summary: Checks whether the specified types of collision data exist for the given surface. The check is controlled by the flags parameter, which indicates which data types to validate. If -1 is passed for surface parameter, checks all surfaces in the mesh. This method does not validate geometry content. Instead, if a surface lacks valid geometry (e.g., no indices, empty targets), it is treated as not requiring collision data, and the function returns true.
member.param: Index of the surface to check. If -1 is passed, all surfaces in the mesh are checked.
Bitmask that specifies which types of collision data to check.
member.returns: Returns true if collision data exists, or surface has no valid geometry, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.clearSurface(int,int)
member.summary: Clears vertex data for the specified surface and target. If -1 is passed, all surfaces and targets will be cleared.
member.param: Index of the surface to clear. If -1 is passed, all surfaces will be cleared.
Index of the target to clear. If -1 is passed, all targets within the surface will be cleared.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getRandomPoint(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,int) const
member.summary: Generates a random point on the specified surface, along with its normal. The velocity is always set to zero.
member.param: Generated point on the surface.
Interpolated normal at the point.
Always zero.
Index of the surface to generate the random point on.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid surface was found and the point was generated, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceCollision(Unigine.Math.BoundBox,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Checks for surface-level collisions between the mesh and a bounding box.
member.param: Bounding box to check for collisions.
Output vector to recieve indices of intersecting surfaces.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one surface collided with the given bounding box, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceCollision(Unigine.Math.BoundFrustum,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Checks for surface-level collisions between the mesh and a bounding frustum.
member.param: Bounding frustum to check for collisions.
Output vector to recieve indices of intersecting surfaces.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one surface collided with the given bounding frustum, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceCollision(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Checks for surface-level collisions between the mesh and a line segment.
member.param: Start point of the line segment.
End point of the line segment.
Output vector to recieve indices of intersecting surfaces.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one surface collided with the given line segment, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTriangleCollision(Unigine.Math.BoundBox,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int) const
member.summary: Checks for collisions between the specified bounding box and triangles on the given surface. If any triangles intersect the box, their indices are added to the OUT_triangles array.
member.param: Bounding box to check for collisions.
Output vector to store the indices of intersected triangles.
Index of the surface to check.
member.returns: true if any triangle was intersected, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTriangleCollision(Unigine.Math.BoundFrustum,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int) const
member.summary: Checks for collisions between the specified frustum and triangles on the given surface. If any triangles intersect the frustum, their indices are written to the OUT_triangles array.
member.param: Bounding frustum to check for collisions.
Output vector to store the indices of intersected triangles.
Index of the surface to check.
member.returns: true if any triangle was intersected, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTriangleCollision(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int) const
member.summary: Checks for collisions between the line segment defined by p0 and p1, and the triangles on the specified surface. If any triangles intersect the line segment, their indices are added to OUT_triangles.
member.param: Start point of the line segment.
End point of the line segment.
Output vector to store the indices of intersected triangles.
Index of the surface to check.
member.returns: true if any triangle was intersected, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.dvec3,Unigine.Math.dvec3,Unigine.Math.dvec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,int,int,int) const
member.summary: Performs a ray-triangle intersection test against the specified surface and target. If an intersection occurs, the closest intersection point, its normal, and the triangle index are returned via the corresponding output arguments.
member.param: Start point of the ray in world coordinates.
End point of the ray in world coordinates.
Pointer to store the intersection point.
Pointer to store the surface normal at the intersection point.
Pointer to store the triangle index of the intersection.
Index of the surface to test.
Index of the target within the surface.
member.returns: Returns true if the ray intersects any triangle within the mesh, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.clearSpatialTree(int)
member.summary: Clears the spatial tree data for the specified surface. If -1 is passed, the spatial tree will be cleared for all surfaces.
member.param: Index of the surface. If -1 is passed, spatial trees will be cleared for all surfaces in the mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.clearEdges(int)
member.summary: Clears edge data for the specified surface. If -1 is passed, edge data will be cleared for all surfaces in the mesh.
member.param: Index of the surface. If -1 is passed, edge data will be cleared for all surfaces in the mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getSurfaceCollision(CollisionFilter,CollisionResult)
member.summary: Performs a spatial query over all surfaces in the mesh, applying user-defined bounding box filter and invoking a callback for each matching surface index. This can be useful if you want to implement your own logic for collision detection based on bounding boxes.
member.param: A function pointer or lambda with the following signature: bool filter(const Math::BoundBox& bb). The function should return true if the bounding box should be considered for collision; otherwise false.
A function pointer or lambda with the following signature: void surface_index_result(int index). The function is invoked for each surface index whose bounding box passes the filter.

member.name: M:Unigine.Mesh.getTriangleCollision(CollisionFilter,CollisionResult,int)
member.summary: Performs a spatial query on a specific surface to detect colliding triangles. For each triangle whose bounding volume passes the given filter, a callback function is invoked with its index. If the surface has a spatial tree, the search is faster due to optimized traversal.
member.param: A function pointer or lambda with the following signature: bool filter(const Math::BoundBox& bb). The function should return true if the bounding box should be considered for collision; otherwise false.
A function pointer or lambda with the following signature: void triangle_index_result(int index). The function is invoked for each triangle index whose bounding box passes the filter.
The index of the surface to query.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_32
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 32 x 32.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_64
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 64 x 64.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_128
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 128 x 128.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_256
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 256 x 256.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_512
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 512 x 512.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_1024
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 1024 x 1024.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_2048
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 2048 x 2048.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.LIGHTMAP_RESOLUTION_MODE_4096
member.summary: Lightmap resolution 4096 x 4096.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.VERTEX_CACHE
member.summary: Vertex cache optimization flag.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.BACK_TO_FRONT
member.summary: Flag, which is used for mesh indices optimization. If this flag is set, polygons will be rendered in back-to-front order (from the exterior polygons to the central polygons of the mesh).

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.VERTEX_CACHE_LEGACY
member.summary: Vertex cache optimization flag (legacy). Since v.2.20 the mesh indices optimization behavior has changed - use this flag for cases that require the previous behavior (for example, for lightmaps).

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.BACK_TO_FRONT_LEGACY
member.summary: Flag used for rendering polygons in back-to-front order (legacy). Since v.2.20 the mesh indices optimization behavior has changed - use this flag for cases that require the previous behavior (for example, for lightmaps).

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.NUM_WEIGHTS
member.summary: Number of vertices weights.

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.COLLISION_DATA_BOUNDS
member.summary: Targets bounding volume data in collision-related methods. (e.g. createCollisionData())

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.COLLISION_DATA_EDGES
member.summary: Targets edge data in collision-related methods. (e.g. createCollisionData())

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.COLLISION_DATA_SPATIAL_TREE
member.summary: Targets spatial tree data in collision-related methods. (e.g. createCollisionData())

member.name: F:Unigine.Mesh.COLLISION_DATA_ALL
member.summary: Flag that targets all collision data types in collision-related methods. (e.g. createCollisionData())

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.save(char) const
member.summary: Saves the given animation in the ANIM file format. Creates the given file if it doesnt exist yet (including subdirectories).
member.param: Path to a file including the file name and extension to which animation is to be saved (*.anim).

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.findBone(char) const
member.summary: Searches for a bone with a given name and returns its number.
member.param: Name of the bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.addBone(char,int)
member.summary: Appends a new mesh bone.
member.param: Bone name. This argument is empty by default.
Parent bone number. The default value is -1 (the new bone has no parent bone).

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setBoneName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets the name for the given bone.
member.param: Bone number.
Bone name.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getBoneName(int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the given bone.
member.param: Bone number.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setBoneParent(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the bone specified as the second argument as the parent bone for the bone specified as the first argument.
member.param: Number of the bone, for which the parent will be returned.
Parent bone number, if the parent exists; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getBoneParent(int) const
member.summary: Returns the number of the parent bone for a given one.
member.param: Number of the bone, for which the parent will be returned.
member.returns: Parent bone number, if the parent exists; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setBoneTransform(int,Unigine.Math.mat4)
member.summary: Sets a transformation matrix for the given bone (without considering node transformations). Bones can be scaled only uniformly.
member.param: Bone number.
Transformation matrix.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getBoneTransform(int) const
member.summary: Returns a transformation matrix of the given bone relatively to the parent object (not considering transformations of the Mesh Skinned node itself).
member.param: Bone number.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setBoneTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets transformation matrices for all bones. The transforms are in the object-space coordinates (not local, i.e. not bound to the parent bone).
member.param: Transformation matrices in the object-space coordinates.
member.returns: 1 if transforms are set successfully for bones. The return value of 0 means that the number of transforms did not match the number of bones

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getBoneTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns transformation matrices for all bones The transforms are in the object-space coordinates (not local, i.e. not bound to the parent bone).
member.param: Transformation matrices in the object-space coordinates.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getNumAnimationBones const
member.summary: Returns the total number of mesh animation bones.
member.returns: Number of the mesh animation bones.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getAnimationBoneID(int) const
member.summary: Returns the mesh bone ID for the specified animated bone.
member.param: Bone index in the list of animated bones.
member.returns: Bone ID in the list of mesh bones.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setAnimationBones(Unigine.Vector{short,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Copies bones from the given array to the current array of animation bones.
member.param: Array of bones taking part in the animation to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getAnimationBones(Unigine.Vector{short,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Adds all bones of the given animation to the given array of bones.
member.param: Array with indices of bones taking part in the animation.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setAnimationBoneTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
member.summary: Sets transforms for the specified frame. This method applies transformations to all bones in the mesh, then takes transforms for animated bones and writes them into the frame. All transfomrs are object-bound.
member.param: Animation bone transformation matrix, in the object space.
Animation frame.
member.returns: 0, if the number of transforms doesn't match the number of bones in the mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getAnimationBoneTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int) const
member.summary: Returns a transformation matrix for the specified frame. If bones are animated, transforms for them are taken from the frame, if bones are not animated, their transforms are taken from the mesh. All transforms are object-bound.
member.param: Animation bone transformation matrix, in the object space.
Animation frame.
member.returns: Always returns 1, as it always performs correctly.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setNumFrames(int)
member.summary: Sets the number of frames for the animation.
member.param: Number of the animation frames.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getNumFrames const
member.summary: Returns the number of frames for the animation.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setFrame(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets the animation frame transformation matrices. If the number of transforms does not match the number of animated bones, the method won't be applied.
member.param: Frame number in the array of the animation frames.
Bones transformation matrices in local space relevant to the parent bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getFrame(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns the animation frame transformation matrices.
member.param: Frame number in the array of the animation frames.
Bones transformation matrices in local space relevant to the parent bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.setFrame(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec3,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.quat,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec3,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets the animation frame coordinates, rotation quaternions and scaling vectors.
member.param: Frame number in the array of the animation frames.
Array with coordinates of the animation frame.
Array with rotation quaternions of the animation frame.
Array with scaling vectors of the animation frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.MeshAnimation.getFrame(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec3,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.quat,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.vec3,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns the animation frame coordinates, rotation quaternions and scaling vectors.
member.param: Frame number in the array of the animation frames.
Array with coordinates of the animation frame.
Array with rotation quaternions of the animation frame.
Array with scaling vectors of the animation frame.
